intro: Pogadelpha maculata, commonly known as the spotted pogonandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant features opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pogadelpha maculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
